instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage not turn onwith battery connected
threads.message: Hello, i have a touchbar 13 inch that had liquid damage in following area: <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>, QB701 and <CAPACITOR>C6554</CAPACITOR> & <CAPACITOR>C6553</CAPACITOR> (these last 2 not shorted). The machine was previously running from battery (when customer arrived), but display sometimes flickering, it had some waterspil. Since I assumed all was OK we ultra soniced it (did make pictures of the liquid damage prior to ultrasonic) and now the board starts up fine, but only without battery connected. The original battery was blown up, so we replaced it with a known working battery. When connecting a charger it show 20v but 0amp and not booting. When we remove the battery it starts up fine. Checked already the resister around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> they measure OK, <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> area looks very clean. Images attached for reference. What should I check first? Will checkout lewis videos as well but have a big pile to fix so not much time to watch all hope you can point me in the right direction.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage not turn onwith battery connected
threads.message:
Post exact voltage for <SIGNAL>CHGR_A</SIGNAL>/BMON signals.
Try to start in SMC bypass mode, with both charger and battery connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage not turn onwith battery connected
threads.message: With only the AC Charger connected i get 0.068v. Resistors measure OK though

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage not turn onwith battery connected
threads.message:
Both signals same voltage?
Check them with charger and battery connected at same time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage not turn onwith battery connected
threads.message: PRAM reset without battery, then connect the battery did the trick. Charging now, thanks!
